events.originalText: The South Sudanese Civil War began when three opposition leaders voted to boycott the meeting of the National Liberation Council in Juba.
events.subtitle: South Sudanese Civil War
events.headline: South Sudanese Civil War Begins with Opposition Leaders' Boycott in Juba

events.originalText: The F-22 Raptor, an early successful stealth fighter, entered into service despite a protracted and costly development period.
events.subtitle: Lockheed Martin F-22 Raptor
events.headline: F-22 Raptor Enters Service Despite Costly Development Period

events.originalText: The Iraqi Shia Islamist group al-Dawa carried out one of the first modern suicide bombings, targeting the Iraqi embassy in Beirut, Lebanon, resulting in 61 deaths and at least 100 injuries.
events.subtitle: Shia Islam
events.headline: Al-Dawa Group Carries Out Suicide Bombing at Iraqi Embassy in Beirut

events.originalText: The Soviet spacecraft Venera 7 touched down on the surface of Venus, making the first successful landing of a spacecraft on another planet.
events.subtitle: Venera 7
events.headline: Soviet Spacecraft Venera 7 Successfully Lands on Venus

events.originalText: Former Nazi leader Adolf Eichmann was sentenced to death after being found guilty on fifteen criminal charges, including war crimes and crimes against humanity.
events.subtitle: Adolf Eichmann
events.headline: Adolf Eichmann Sentenced to Death for War Crimes

events.originalText: U.S.-backed Iranian troops brought an end to the Iran crisis when they marched on the breakaway Republic of Mahabad and recaptured the territory.
events.subtitle: Iran crisis of 1946
events.headline: U.S.-Backed Iranian Troops End Iran Crisis in Mahabad

events.originalText: The US-led occupying forces ordered the government of Japan to cease state support for Shinto.
events.subtitle: Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers
events.headline: US-led Forces Order Japan to Cease State Support for Shinto

events.originalText: World War II: Australian and American forces (pictured) began the Battle of Arawe against Japanese forces on New Britain as a diversion before a larger landing at Cape Gloucester.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Australian and American Forces Begin Battle of Arawe Against Japanese

events.originalText: The American historical epic film Gone With the Wind, adapted from Margaret Mitchell's Pulitzer Prize–winning novel of the same name, premiered in Atlanta, Georgia.
events.subtitle: Epic film
events.headline: Gone With the Wind Premieres in Atlanta, Georgia

events.originalText: The Great Northern, Piccadilly and Brompton Railway, a 14.17-kilometre (8.80 mi) long deep-level underground tube railway connecting Hammersmith and Finsbury Park, London, opened.
events.subtitle: Great Northern, Piccadilly and Brompton Railway
events.headline: London Underground Railway Connecting Hammersmith and Finsbury Park Opens

events.originalText: Sitting Bull, a Hunkpapa Lakota leader, was killed on Standing Rock Indian Reservation in South Dakota by U.S. Indian agency police.
events.subtitle: Sitting Bull
events.headline: Hunkpapa Lakota Leader Sitting Bull Killed on Standing Rock Reservation

events.originalText: Sixteen-year-old Ella Stewart sent the first telegraphed message from Arizona Territory.
events.subtitle: Ella Stewart Udall
events.headline: Sixteen-Year-Old Ella Stewart Sends First Telegraphed Message from Arizona

events.originalText: American Civil War: Union troops defeated the Army of Tennessee, one of the largest Confederate forces, at the Battle of Nashville.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Union Troops Defeat Confederate Army of Tennessee at Battle of Nashville

events.originalText: War of the First Coalition: The French navy launched an expedition to Ireland to assist the Society of United Irishmen in a rebellion against the British.
events.subtitle: War of the First Coalition
events.headline: French Navy Launches Expedition to Ireland in War of the First Coalition

events.originalText: The first ten amendments to the United States Constitution, collectively known as the Bill of Rights, were ratified.
events.subtitle: List of amendments to the Constitution of the United States
events.headline: Bill of Rights Ratified as First Ten Amendments to U.S. Constitution

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: At the Battle of St. Lucia, the Royal Navy prevented French Navy ships from reaching their garrison on Saint Lucia in the West Indies.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Royal Navy Prevents French Navy Ships from Reaching Saint Lucia Garrison

events.originalText: Constantine VIII became the sole Byzantine emperor, 63 years after being crowned co-emperor.
events.subtitle: Constantine VIII
events.headline: Constantine VIII Becomes Sole Byzantine Emperor

events.originalText: Sergius was elected pope, ending the last disputed period of sede vacante during the Byzantine Papacy.
events.subtitle: Pope Sergius I
events.headline: Sergius Elected Pope, Ending Disputed Period of Byzantine Papacy
